USA: The Fordney–McCumber Tariff was signed into law.
Slovenia: Julian March (Julijska krajina) is incorporated to Italy.
Rwanda: Ruanda-Urundi are joined as a League of Nations mandate, governed by Belgium.
Philippine: Mrs. Redgrave pioneers the radio broadcasting from Nichols Field, only for a test broadcast.
Henry Hermann, owner of an electrical supply company, begins operating three radio stations in Manila and Pasay, also for their test broadcasts.
Malaysia: Haji Abdul Rahman Limbong represented one of the 43 farmers being put to trial in a court for doing farming without permission.
Italy: After the lack of a compromise between socialists and Christian-democrats, and the March on Rome of the fascist militias, Benito Mussolini is named by the King as prime minister of Italy.
Ireland: Irish Civil War: Bombardment by Michael Collins of Anti-Treaty forces occupying the Four Courts marks the start of the Irish Civil War
Haiti: Louis Bornó is elected to a four-year term as president by the State Council
President Dartiguenave's term ends; Louis Bornó is sworn into office
The Central School of Agriculture (Ecole Centrale d'Agriculture) is founded in Damien
Germany: Germany and Russia signed the Treaty of Rapallo, in which each renounced all territorial and financial claims against the other and pledged to normalize relations.
Estonia: Estonia joined the League of Nations.
Burundi: Burundi and Rwanda were joined into the League of Nations mandate of Ruanda-Urundi, governed by Belgium.
Brazil: Modern Art Week is held in São Paulo, marking the beginning of Brazilian Modernism.
In the Brazilian presidential election, Artur Bernardes of the Mineiro Republican Party receives 56.0% of the vote.
The 18 of the Copacabana Fort revolt occurs in Rio de Janeiro, then Federal District of Brazil. It is the first revolt of the tenentista movement, in the context of the Brazilian Old Republic.
Australia: The Smith Family charity is founded in Sydney
Australian federal election, 1922: Billy Hughes reelected as Prime Minister.
Albania: Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople Patriarch Meletius IV of Constantinople recognized the Orthodox Autocephalous Church of Albania.
Afghanistan: Solar Hijri calendar officially adopted in Afghanistan.
